text: hi my name is Gareth Edwards and the
director of a new film called monsters
and as well as directing also did the
visual effects I'm going to break down
one of the scenes here and explain
exactly how i went about doing this the
scene we're looking at is just on a
river boat at night after it's broken
down and a thin appears in the water and
eventually we realize it belongs to an
airplane and confusingly they take
photos and some light flashes back and
we realize that creature has got this
plane in its claws and is somehow using
it's a toy you start with the background
and you remove all the things that in
the foreground so you've got just a
background on its own and that's what
you concentrate on doing the shot so you
can buy 3d models off the internet like
you can buy props in real life and I
bought one of a fighter jet and then you
text to it and you add all these
textures to it to make it look more real
but also add to add murdered and leaves
and things and essentially once you have
this model you can then animate it so
you create a path for the plane to go on
and to sing can I go through the whole
scene as if it's one thing and then when
I'm happy with that I also have to
create the tentacles that that grab the
plane you do that by having like a sort
of cone shape that is attached to and
follows a line that is animated grabbing
the these little lines that animated
grabbing their plane and then the
corrupt the cone basically the forms
based on that line and I texture them to
look more like real organic tentacles of
a creature and so it's a matter of them
put in all these bits together so that
you have the whole thing looking pretty
good against the background then once
you are happy with that you can then
stick that background into the original
shot and then the object hopefully looks
like it's really there and that's pretty
much how I did it
